title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to vespadb
text: outlines propose change vespadb. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to vespadb
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to vespadb
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to vespadb
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("inbo/vespadb", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to vespadb
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to vespadb
text: Please note vespadb project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Read Data from the vespa-db Database
text: vespa-db database created vespawatch make Vespa velutina nest observations available near real time possible. platform contains observations different sources, currently new observations added [waarnemingen.)[https://waarnemingen./]. order observation included vespa-db, needs following properties: currently identified Vespa velutina subspiecies thereof. activity: Nest (observations individuals included) validated validator, means photo. Automatically validated (based location likelyhood) observations included.

what: How did this package come to be
title: Read Data from the vespa-db Database
text: package initially written @PietrH context importing historical data vespa-db. matching validation purposes convenient wrap api functions imports matching quickly tested. original code resides private repository: inbo/vespaR. Later need arose query vespa-db api , original code moved broad reuse.

title: Read Data from the vespa-db Database
text: overview available API endpoints (certainly wrapped ), see: https://db.vespawatch./swagger/.

title: Read Data from the vespa-db Database
text: can install development version vespadb GitHub :

title: Read Data from the vespa-db Database
text: two options get data vespa-db. fastest way fetch recent export file. file generated every day around 4AM Brussels time. Alternativly can also send queries database direclty get live data back. much slower. example fetch data first 25 days July 2025, municipality Leuven. get overview available parameters can use query observation data, see get_observation_parameters(). can also get overview municipality codes, query municipality code directly function municipalities:
code: library(vespadb) get_vespadb_export() #> # A tibble: 25,014 × 27 #>       id observation_datetime latitude longitude province     municipality anb   #>    <dbl> <dttm>                  <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>        <chr>        <lgl> #>  1 14861 2025-04-11 10:59:00      51.0      3.38 West-Vlaand… Wingene      FALSE #>  2 14862 2025-04-11 00:00:00      51.1      4.62 Antwerpen    Nijlen       FALSE #>  3 14863 2025-04-11 11:14:00      51.2      4.43 Antwerpen    Antwerpen    FALSE #>  4 14865 2025-04-10 13:57:00      50.9      2.90 West-Vlaand… Ieper        FALSE #>  5 14866 2025-04-10 00:00:00      51.2      3.20 West-Vlaand… Brugge       FALSE #>  6 14867 2025-04-10 20:29:00      50.8      4.92 Vlaams Brab… Tienen       FALSE #>  7 14868 2025-04-10 20:01:00      51.1      3.56 Oost-Vlaand… Lievegem     FALSE #>  8 14869 2025-04-10 18:53:00      50.9      5.38 Limburg      Hasselt      FALSE #>  9 14870 2025-04-10 17:40:00      51.1      4.46 Antwerpen    Kontich      FALSE #> 10 14871 2025-04-10 16:07:00      50.9      4.36 Vlaams Brab… Grimbergen   FALSE #> # ℹ 25,004 more rows #> # ℹ 20 more variables: nest_status <chr>, eradication_date <chr>, #> #   eradication_result <chr>, images <chr>, nest_type <chr>, #> #   nest_location <chr>, nest_height <chr>, nest_size <chr>, #> #   queen_present <lgl>, moth_present <lgl>, duplicate_nest <lgl>, #> #   other_species_nest <lgl>, notes <lgl>, source <chr>, source_id <dbl>, #> #   wn_id <dbl>, wn_validation_status <chr>, wn_cluster_id <dbl>, … get_vespadb_obs(   municipality_id = 32,   min_observation_datetime = "2025-07-01T00:00:00",   max_observation_datetime = "2025-07-25T00:00:00" ) #> # A tibble: 38 × 30 #>       id created_datetime    modified_datetime   location$type source  source_id #>    <int> <chr>               <chr>               <chr>         <chr>   <lgl>     #>  1 40399 2025-07-03T04:00:31 2025-07-03T04:00:34 Point         Waarne… NA        #>  2 40466 2025-07-04T04:00:05 2025-08-10T00:45:30 Point         Waarne… NA        #>  3 40881 2025-07-08T02:00:19 2025-07-08T02:00:21 Point         Waarne… NA        #>  4 41064 2025-07-10T02:00:11 2025-07-29T11:11:37 Point         Waarne… NA        #>  5 40612 2025-07-06T02:00:08 2025-07-25T00:13:13 Point         Waarne… NA        #>  6 40604 2025-07-06T02:00:08 2025-07-06T02:00:11 Point         Waarne… NA        #>  7 44148 2025-08-05T02:02:02 2025-08-05T02:02:03 Point         Waarne… NA        #>  8 41066 2025-07-10T02:00:11 2025-07-22T14:09:04 Point         Waarne… NA        #>  9 41061 2025-07-10T02:00:11 2025-07-22T14:13:14 Point         Waarne… NA        #> 10 41074 2025-07-10T02:00:14 2025-07-10T02:00:17 Point         Waarne… NA        #> # A tibble: 16 × 11 #>    name       `in`  description required type  format default items$type example #>    <chr>      <chr> <chr>       <lgl>    <chr> <chr>    <int> <chr>      <list>  #>  1 municipal… query municipali… FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #>  2 province_… query province_id FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #>  3 min_creat… query min_create… FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #>  4 max_creat… query max_create… FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #>  5 min_modif… query min_modifi… FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #>  6 max_modif… query max_modifi… FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #>  7 min_obser… query min_observ… FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #>  8 max_obser… query max_observ… FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #>  9 anb        query anb         FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #> 10 nest_type  query nest_type   FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #> 11 visible    query visible     FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #> 12 nest_stat… query nest_status FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #> 13 ordering   query Which fiel… FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #> 14 dist       query Represents… FALSE    numb… float     1000 <NA>       <NULL>  #> 15 point      query Point repr… FALSE    array <NA>        NA float      <int>   #> 16 cursor     query The pagina… FALSE    stri… <NA>        NA <NA>       <NULL>  #> # title: Fetches the result from a given URL with optional query parameters and authentication. — fetch_result
text: Fetches result given URL optional query parameters authentication.

title: Fetches the result from a given URL with optional query parameters and authentication. — fetch_result
Fetches the result from a given URL with optional query parameters and authentication. — fetch_result
text: url API endpoint fetch result . .query_params Optional query parameters include request. .auth Optional path authentication cookie use. return_request TRUE, function returns request object instead response.

title: Fetches the result from a given URL with optional query parameters and authentication. — fetch_result
text: response object request object return_request TRUE.

title: Fetches the result from a given URL with optional query parameters and authentication. — fetch_result
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Fetch result from a URL fetch_result("https://uat-db.vespawatch.be/observations/30608")  # Fetch result with query parameters fetch_result("https://uat-db.vespawatch.be/observations/",              .query_params = list(municipality_id = 215)) # Return request object instead of response fetch_result("https://uat-db.vespawatch.be/observations/30608",             return_request = TRUE) } # }

title: get_vespadb_export — get_vespadb_export
text: Daily around 4 export created VespaDB API stored S3. function retrieves latest export S3 returns tibble. function useful getting snapshot data VespaDB API getting large amount data.

title: get_vespadb_export — get_vespadb_export
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get the latest export from the VespaDB API get_vespadb_export() # Get the latest export from the VespaDB API in the production instance get_vespadb_export(domain = "production") } # }

title: get_vespadb_obs — get_vespadb_obs
text: Query vespa-db api get observations

title: get_vespadb_obs — get_vespadb_obs
text: ... <dynamic-dots> Query parameters according observation model. auth Character. Path authentication cookie use. default request without authentication placed (public data ). authentication cookie can created using login_vespadb() returns path cookie. domain Character. domain login . Default "uat" UAT environment.

title: get_vespadb_obs — get_vespadb_obs
text: tibble observations VespaDB API.

title: get_vespadb_obs — get_vespadb_obs
text: Extra query parameters supported according Observation model. information allowed parameters can fetched via get_field_definitions(). function already handles paging, supplying page parameter allowed. low level function fetch results see fetch_result().

title: get_vespadb_obs — get_vespadb_obs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # All public records get_vespadb_obs()  # Public records from Ghent get_vespadb_obs(municipality_id = 215)  # Public and private information from Ghent, only ANB plots get_vespadb_obs(   municipality_id = 215,   anb = "true",   auth = login_vespadb() ) } # }
